commits.message:
fix: При создании вложенной задачи теперь автоматически разворачивается вся родительская иерархия в дереве задач на вкладке "AllTasks"

Это делает новую задачу сразу видимой пользователю, улучшая UX

wiki_catalogs.name: System Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the Unlimotion system. Explain its purpose as a full-stack, cross-platform task management application with unlimited nesting, multi-parent relationships, and roadmap visualization. Describe the core architecture combining AvaloniaUI for UI, ServiceStack for server APIs, RavenDB for persistence, and Quartz.NET for scheduling. Document the relationship between client applications (Desktop, Android, iOS, Browser) and the central server component. Include both conceptual overviews for beginners and technical details for experienced developers. Provide practical examples demonstrating common use cases such as task creation, blocking, and synchronization. Include diagrams illustrating the overall system context and component interactions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Task Nesting
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the task nesting feature. Explain the implementation of unlimited task nesting using the ContainsTasks and ParentTasks collections in TaskItem. Document how AddChildTask in TaskTreeManager creates parent-child relationships and updates both parent's ContainsTasks and child's ParentTasks. Include code examples from FileTaskStorage.AddChild and TaskTreeManager.CreateParentChildRelation to illustrate the bidirectional relationship management. Describe how the system maintains data consistency during nesting operations and handles edge cases like circular references. Address common issues such as orphaned tasks and provide troubleshooting guidance for synchronization problems between UI and storage layers.

wiki_catalogs.name: Local Storage
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the local storage mechanism in Unlimotion. Explain how FileTaskStorage reads and writes task data to JSON files on the local filesystem, including the structure of the serialized TaskItem objects and the use of JsonCommaFixer to repair malformed JSON. Document the role of TaskTreeManager in maintaining an in-memory representation of the task hierarchy and synchronizing it with disk. Include examples of file operations, error handling during I/O, and recovery strategies for corrupted files. Describe the data lifecycle from UI interaction to persistence, and detail configuration options such as storage path and auto-save intervals. Address common issues like file locking, partial writes, and performance implications of large task trees.

wiki_catalogs.name: Telegram Bot Integration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Telegram Bot integration. Thoroughly explain the implementation of command handling (/search, /task, /root), callback query processing, and message routing in the Bot class. Document the initialization process via StartAsync, including configuration loading, access control via AllowedUsers, and the setup of periodic Git synchronization timers. Detail the OnMessageReceived and OnCallbackQueryReceived event handlers, including state management for task creation workflows (CreateSub, CreateSib), inline keyboard generation, and task display formatting with emoji indicators. Include concrete examples of user interaction flows, error handling practices, and logging integration. Address configuration requirements in appsettings.json, including BotToken, user access control, and Git settings. Explain the role of TaskService and GitService dependencies, their initialization, and interaction patterns. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common issues such as authentication failures, message delivery errors, and synchronization conflicts.

wiki_catalogs.name: Task Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for this sub-feature focused on task management workflows in Unlimotion. Thoroughly explain task creation (sibling, inner, blocked), deletion, and state transitions (not completed, in progress, completed, archived). Document the implementation of ReactiveCommands in MainWindowViewModel for task operations and the state management logic in TaskItemViewModel. Include concrete examples from the codebase showing how tasks are added, removed, and updated through ITaskStorage. Explain the relationship between UI actions and backend storage, including how property changes trigger automatic saves. Address common issues such as preventing creation of unnamed tasks and handling multi-parent relationships. Provide practical usage examples and performance considerations for managing large task hierarchies.

wiki_catalogs.name: Move Operation (Shift)
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Move operation in drag-and-drop functionality using the Shift key. Explain how the Shift modifier triggers the MoveInto operation through ITaskStorage, relocating the dragged task under the target task while maintaining its existing relationships. Document the implementation in MainWindowViewModel where keyboard modifiers are detected and translated into storage commands. Include code examples showing the interaction between GraphControl's drag handlers and the ViewModel's command execution. Address user experience aspects such as visual feedback during the move, handling of multi-parent tasks, and potential conflicts when moving blocked tasks. Provide best practices for when to use move versus other operations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Task Creation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for task creation workflows in Unlimotion. Explain the implementation of Create, CreateSibling, CreateInner, and CreateBlockedSibling commands in MainWindowViewModel. Document how new TaskItemViewModel instances are instantiated with proper ITaskStorage injection and how parent-child or blocking relationships are established during creation. Include examples from the code showing the use of ReactiveCommand.CreateFromTask for asynchronous task creation and the role of AddChild and Add methods in FileTaskStorage. Address validation logic that prevents creation of unnamed tasks and explain how the CurrentTaskItem is updated after creation. Provide guidance on best practices for creating different task types and performance considerations when managing large hierarchies.

wiki_catalogs.name: All Tasks View
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the All Tasks view in Unlimotion. Explain how the CurrentItems collection in MainWindowViewModel is populated by filtering root-level tasks based on completion and archival status, emoji inclusion/exclusion, and parent relationships. Document the reactive pipeline using DynamicData that maintains this collection in real-time as tasks are added, updated, or removed. Include code examples showing the use of AutoRefreshOnObservable, Filter, Transform, and Sort operators. Describe how sorting is persisted via configuration and how the view integrates with the breadcrumbs system through BredScrumbsAlgorithms.WrapperParent. Address common user issues such as tasks not appearing in the view and provide troubleshooting steps related to filter settings and task hierarchy.

wiki_catalogs.name: Emoji Filtering Mechanism
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the emoji filtering mechanism in Unlimotion. Explain how the DynamicData library is used to create reactive observable chains that group tasks by their emoji using the EmojiPattern regex. Document the implementation of _emojiFilters and _emojiExcludeFilters collections in MainWindowViewModel, including how they are bound to the UI and updated reactively when task properties change. Include examples from the code showing the use of .Connect(), .Group(), .Transform(), and .Bind() methods to create real-time filtering pipelines. Explain how filter state changes are propagated through .WhenAnyValue() subscriptions and how the resulting predicates are applied across different task views (All Tasks, Unlocked, Completed, etc.). Address performance considerations for large datasets and the role of AutoRefreshOnObservable in maintaining filter accuracy.

wiki_catalogs.name: Reactive Data Flow
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the reactive data flow in the emoji filtering mechanism. Explain how the DynamicData library is used to create observable chains starting from taskRepository.Tasks.Connect(). Document the implementation of .AutoRefreshOnObservable() to detect changes in task emoji properties and how .Group() aggregates tasks by their emoji values. Describe the role of .Transform() in creating EmojiFilter view models and how .SortBy() and .Bind() are used to maintain sorted collections. Include examples from the code showing the complete pipeline from raw task data to bound filter collections (_emojiFilters and _emojiExcludeFilters). Explain how AutoRefreshOnObservable ensures filters update when task emojis change and how the resulting collections are exposed as EmojiFilters properties.

wiki_catalogs.name: Emoji Inheritance Traversal Logic
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the emoji inheritance traversal logic in Unlimotion. Explain how the GetAllParents() method in TaskItemViewModel recursively traverses the parent hierarchy using a depth-first approach with a visited HashSet to prevent circular reference infinite loops. Document the use of ordered traversal via ParentsTasks.OrderBy(m => m.Title) to ensure consistent emoji ordering. Include examples from the code showing how the traversal builds an ordered list of parent tasks and how this list is used to construct the final emoji string. Address edge cases such as circular parent references, performance implications of deep hierarchies, and thread safety considerations in the traversal algorithm.

wiki_catalogs.name: Technology Stack
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the Unlimotion technology stack. Detail the primary programming language (C#/.NET) and critical frameworks including AvaloniaUI for cross-platform UI, ServiceStack for server API, RavenDB for document database, Quartz.NET for job scheduling, AutoMapper for object mapping, and DynamicData for reactive collections. Explain the role of each technology in the architecture and their integration patterns. Document version compatibility, third-party dependency management via NuGet, and build configuration through Directory.Build.props. Include practical examples of how these technologies work together in the codebase. Address performance considerations and best practices for using each component.

wiki_catalogs.name: Task Relationships
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for task relationship management. Explain the multi-parent relationship implementation using ParentTasks and ContainsTasks collections in TaskItem. Document how CopyInto and MoveInto operations in FileTaskStorage interact with AddNewParentToTask and MoveTaskToNewParent in TaskTreeManager to manage complex parentage. Include examples of how tasks can have multiple parents and how the system handles sorting and ordering in such scenarios. Describe the data consistency mechanisms during relationship changes and provide guidance on avoiding data integrity issues. Address performance considerations when dealing with tasks that have numerous parent relationships.

wiki_catalogs.name: Server Synchronization
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the server synchronization system. Explain how ServerTaskStorage communicates with the backend via ServiceStack to push and pull task data, including authentication, conflict resolution, and delta updates. Detail the serialization format used (TaskItemHubMold) and mapping between client and server models. Document the retry logic, offline operation support, and state reconciliation when reconnecting. Include examples of API calls, error handling for network failures, and configuration of server endpoints and timeouts. Address performance considerations for large datasets, bandwidth optimization, and security aspects of data transmission. Provide guidance on troubleshooting sync issues and monitoring synchronization status.

wiki_catalogs.name: Git Synchronization Integration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Git synchronization integration. Explain the implementation and scheduling of GitPullJob and GitPushJob using Quartz.NET, including their Execute methods and integration with IRemoteBackupService. Detail the configuration options defined in GitSettings, such as RepositoryPath, RemoteUrl, credentials, branch settings, and interval controls (PullIntervalSeconds, PushIntervalSeconds). Document the automatic clone-or-update behavior in Bot.StartAsync and the timer-driven synchronization mechanism that triggers pull and push operations at configurable intervals. Include examples of Git commit messages, error handling during network operations, and conflict resolution strategies. Explain the role of IRemoteBackupService abstraction and its implementation for Git operations. Address security considerations for storing credentials in appsettings.json and best practices for repository management. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common synchronization issues such as authentication failures, merge conflicts, network timeouts, and incorrect repository paths.

wiki_catalogs.name: Interface Navigation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for this sub-feature focused on navigating between different views in the Unlimotion application. Explain the implementation of view switching logic in MainWindowViewModel, including the reactive properties (AllTasksMode, UnlockedMode, etc.) that control which view is active. Document how each view (All Tasks, Last Created, Unlocked, Completed, Archived, Roadmap, Settings) binds to different filtered collections of tasks using DynamicData. Include examples from the code showing how the CurrentItems, UnlockedItems, CompletedItems, and other collections are created and maintained. Explain the role of the breadcrumbs system and how it updates based on the current task selection. Address common navigation issues and provide best practices for users to efficiently switch between views and locate tasks.

wiki_catalogs.name: Block Operation (Ctrl)
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Block operation in drag-and-drop functionality using the Ctrl key. Explain how the Ctrl modifier triggers the blocking relationship where the dragged task becomes a blocker of the target task, preventing its completion until the blocker is completed. Document the implementation in MainWindowViewModel where the Block command is executed via ITaskStorage, and how this affects task state evaluation in the UI. Include examples from the code showing the creation of BlockEdge in the GraphControl visualization. Address user experience considerations such as visual indicators of blocked tasks, handling of circular blocking scenarios, and the impact on roadmap visualization. Provide practical examples of using blocking to create task dependencies and execution sequences.

wiki_catalogs.name: Task Deletion
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for task deletion operations in Unlimotion. Explain the implementation of the Remove command in MainWindowViewModel and the RemoveFunc delegate in TaskItemViewModel. Document how the ITaskStorage.Delete method handles both single-parent and multi-parent scenarios, including the logic for determining when a task should be completely removed versus maintaining relationships. Include examples from the code showing the use of ReactiveCommand.CreateFromTask for asynchronous deletion and the connection between UI actions and backend storage updates. Address the confirmation logic in RemoveRequiresConfirmation and explain how child tasks are handled during deletion. Provide guidance on safe deletion patterns and common issues such as preventing accidental removal of important tasks.

wiki_catalogs.name: Unlocked View
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Unlocked view in Unlimotion. Explain how the UnlockedItems collection is constructed by filtering tasks based on their unlocked status using UnlockedTimeFilter.IsUnlocked predicate, along with duration, emoji, and wanted task filters. Document the reactive data flow that monitors changes in task properties like IsCompleted, UnlockedDateTime, and PlannedDuration. Include examples from the code showing the Transform operation that wraps tasks with appropriate actions and the sorting mechanism using CurrentSortDefinitionForUnlocked. Describe how this view supports roadmap planning by surfacing time-sensitive tasks. Address common issues such as tasks not appearing when expected and provide guidance on configuring unlocked time filters and planned durations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Emoji Inheritance Model
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the emoji inheritance model in Unlimotion. Explain how child tasks inherit emojis from all their parent tasks through the GetAllEmoji property in TaskItemViewModel. Document the implementation of the ParentsTasks.ToObservableChangeSet() subscription that triggers updates when parent task emojis change. Include examples from the code showing how the GetAllParents() method traverses the parent hierarchy and how the resulting emoji string is constructed by joining parent emojis. Explain how this inherited emoji data is used in filtering operations through the GetAllEmoji.Contains() checks in the emojiFilter predicate. Address edge cases such as circular parent references, performance implications of deep task hierarchies, and the behavior when parent task emojis are modified after inheritance.

wiki_catalogs.name: UI Binding and Filter Application
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the UI binding aspects of the emoji filtering mechanism. Explain how the _emojiFilters and _emojiExcludeFilters collections are bound to the UI and updated reactively through .WhenAnyValue() subscriptions. Document the implementation of emojiFilter and emojiExcludeFilter observables that convert filter states into predicate functions. Describe how these predicates are applied across different task views (All Tasks, Unlocked, Completed, etc.) through the Filter() method in various Connect() pipelines. Include examples from the code showing how filter state changes propagate to task visibility in different views. Explain the role of ToObservableChangeSet() and AutoRefreshOnObservable() in maintaining filter accuracy when users toggle emoji filters and how the resulting predicates are combined with other filters like completion status and date ranges.

wiki_catalogs.name: Reactive Emoji Inheritance Updates
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the reactive emoji inheritance update mechanism in Unlimotion. Explain how the ParentsTasks.ToObservableChangeSet() subscription with AutoRefreshOnObservable(m => m.WhenAnyValue(m => m.Emoji, m => m.GetAllEmoji)) ensures that GetAllEmoji is automatically updated when any parent task's emoji changes. Document the use of StartWithEmpty() and ToCollection() to handle initial and subsequent updates. Include examples from the code showing how changes to parent task emojis propagate to child tasks through the reactive pipeline. Address performance considerations for large task hierarchies, the throttling mechanism for property changes, and how the system handles concurrent updates to multiple parent emojis.

wiki_catalogs.name: Installation and Setup
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on installing and setting up the Unlimotion application. Provide step-by-step instructions for both release-based installation (Windows, Debian, macOS) and source-based installation requiring .NET 9.0 SDK. Document the execution of platform-specific scripts (run.windows.cmd, run.macos.sh, run.linux.sh) and necessary permissions (chmod on macOS). Include configuration of the TaskStorage Path in settings and environment variables from .env file. Explain Docker-based setup using docker-compose.yml. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common installation issues. Include practical examples of successful setup verification and initial application launch.

wiki_catalogs.name: Blocking Logic
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for task blocking/unblocking logic. Explain the implementation using BlocksTasks and BlockedByTasks collections in TaskItem. Document how the Block and Unblock methods in FileTaskStorage interact with BlockTask and UnblockTask in TaskTreeManager to manage blocking relationships. Include code examples from CreateBlockingBlockedByRelation and BreakBlockingBlockedByRelation to illustrate how blocking constraints are enforced and removed. Describe the business logic for determining when a task is blocked and how this affects task completion eligibility. Address common issues such as circular blocking dependencies and provide troubleshooting guidance for blocking state inconsistencies.

wiki_catalogs.name: Git Backup
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Git-based backup functionality. Explain how GitPullJob and GitPushJob automate synchronization of task data with a remote Git repository using scheduled Quartz.NET jobs. Document the integration with BackupViaGitService for executing Git commands, handling credentials, and managing repository state. Include configuration of Git remote URLs, branch selection, commit messages, and authentication methods via ClientSettings. Provide examples of successful backup workflows, error recovery from failed pushes/pulls, and handling of merge conflicts. Address security considerations for storing credentials, performance impact of frequent commits, and best practices for repository management. Include troubleshooting guidance for common Git operation failures and network issues.

wiki_catalogs.name: Keyboard Shortcuts
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for this sub-feature focused on keyboard shortcuts in Unlimotion. Document all available shortcuts including Ctrl+Enter (create sibling), Shift+Enter (create blocked sibling), Ctrl+Tab (create inner), and Shift+Delete (delete task). Explain how these shortcuts are implemented using ReactiveCommands in MainWindowViewModel and connected to the UI through Avalonia's input system. Include examples from the code showing the command registration process and how keyboard gestures are bound to specific actions. Address common issues such as shortcut conflicts and accessibility considerations. Provide practical examples of workflow optimization using keyboard shortcuts and performance implications of rapid command execution.

wiki_catalogs.name: Be Blocked Operation (Alt)
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Be Blocked operation in drag-and-drop functionality using the Alt key. Explain how the Alt modifier creates a blocking relationship where the target task blocks the dragged task, making the dragged task dependent on the target's completion. Document the implementation in MainWindowViewModel where this operation is handled through ITaskStorage's blocking methods. Include code examples showing how this differs from the Ctrl operation in terms of relationship direction and storage updates. Address user experience aspects such as visual feedback during the operation, validation to prevent circular dependencies, and how this operation integrates with the task state evaluation system. Provide guidance on when to use 'be blocked' versus 'block' operations for proper dependency management.

wiki_catalogs.name: Task State Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for task state transitions in Unlimotion. Explain the implementation of IsCompleted, IsCanBeCompleted, and ArchiveDateTime properties in TaskItemViewModel and their relationship to domain model states. Document the reactive logic in WhenAnyValue subscriptions that automatically update UnlockedDateTime when IsCanBeCompleted changes, and how completing a task triggers cloning for repeatable tasks via Repeater patterns. Include examples from the code showing state transition workflows, such as setting CompletedDateTime on completion and ArchiveDateTime on archiving. Address the logic in ArchiveCommand that handles both archiving and unarchiving with proper child task status management, and explain the role of ShowModalAndChangeChildrenStatuses in user confirmation. Provide guidance on state management best practices and common issues like unintended state cascades.

wiki_catalogs.name: Completed View
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Completed View in Unlimotion. Explain how the CompletedItems collection is populated by filtering tasks where IsCompleted == true, applying date range filtering via CompletedDateFilter, and incorporating emoji-based filters. Document the reactive pipeline that automatically updates the view when tasks are marked as completed. Include code examples showing the SortBy operation that orders tasks by completion date in descending order. Describe how the view maintains its state independently of other views and how filtering options are persisted in configuration. Address common user questions about task visibility and provide troubleshooting guidance for date filter configuration and synchronization issues.

wiki_catalogs.name: User Guide
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on using the Unlimotion application. Explain task management workflows including creation (sibling, inner, blocked), deletion, and state transitions (not completed, in progress, completed, archived). Document interface navigation across all views: All Tasks, Last Created, Unlocked, Completed, Archived, Roadmap, and Settings. Detail keyboard shortcuts (Ctrl+Enter, Shift+Enter, Ctrl+Tab, Shift+Delete) and drag-and-drop operations with modifier keys (Shift, Ctrl, Alt, Ctrl+Shift). Explain emoji-based filtering and inheritance. Provide practical examples of common user workflows and include annotated screenshots from the README.md media.

wiki_catalogs.name: Roadmap Visualization
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for roadmap visualization. Explain the implementation of the graph-based roadmap view using MSAGL (Microsoft Automatic Graph Layout) through the GraphControl and GraphViewModel components. Document how BlockEdge and ContainEdge classes represent task relationships visually, and how CompositeItem manages grouped tasks. Describe the data flow from TaskItemViewModel to the visual representation, including layout algorithms and rendering optimizations. Include examples of how blocking and containment relationships are displayed differently in the roadmap. Address performance considerations for large task networks and provide guidance on customizing the visualization appearance and behavior.

wiki_catalogs.name: Drag and Drop Operations
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for this sub-feature focused on drag-and-drop functionality in Unlimotion. Explain the implementation of drag operations with different modifier keys: Shift (move), Ctrl (block), Alt (be blocked), and Ctrl+Shift (clone). Document how the UI captures mouse events and translates them into appropriate storage operations through ITaskStorage methods like MoveInto, Block, and CopyInto. Include examples from the code showing how the drag handlers determine the operation type based on keyboard modifiers and how the operations are executed asynchronously. Address common issues such as visual feedback during drag operations, handling of multi-parent tasks during moves, and conflict resolution when cloning tasks. Provide best practices for users to effectively organize tasks using drag-and-drop.

wiki_catalogs.name: Clone Operation (Ctrl+Shift)
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Clone operation in drag-and-drop functionality using the Ctrl+Shift key combination. Explain how this operation creates a copy of the dragged task as a subtask of the target task while preserving the original task. Document the implementation in MainWindowViewModel where the CopyInto method of ITaskStorage is invoked, including how task properties, relationships, and metadata are duplicated. Include examples from the code showing the cloning logic and how it handles nested structures and blocking relationships. Address user experience considerations such as visual feedback during cloning, handling of task IDs and uniqueness constraints, and the impact on storage performance when cloning large task hierarchies. Provide best practices for using cloning to replicate task templates or duplicate workflows.

wiki_catalogs.name: Archived View
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Archived View in Unlimotion. Explain how the ArchivedItems collection is created by filtering tasks where IsCompleted == null (archived state), applying date range filtering via ArchivedDateFilter, and incorporating emoji-based filters. Document the reactive data binding that ensures real-time updates when tasks are archived or unarchived. Include examples from the code showing the Transform operation that wraps archived tasks and the SortBy operation that orders them by archive date in descending order. Describe how the view's filtering behavior differs from other views and how users can customize date ranges. Address common issues such as missing archived tasks and provide solutions related to date filter settings and task state transitions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Architecture Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the Unlimotion application. Describe the high-level design using MVVM (Model-View-ViewModel) pattern with clear separation between UI, business logic, and data access layers. Document component interactions, data flows, and integration patterns using Splat for dependency injection and ReactiveUI for reactive programming. Explain technical decisions behind using AvaloniaUI for cross-platform development and ServiceStack for API design. Include system context diagrams and component breakdowns showing the relationship between client applications, server, and data storage. Address cross-cutting concerns like configuration management, error handling, and state persistence.

wiki_catalogs.name: Emoji Filtering
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for this sub-feature focused on emoji-based filtering in Unlimotion. Explain how emoji in task titles are parsed using the EmojiPattern regex and inherited by child tasks through the GetAllEmoji property. Document the implementation of emoji filters in MainWindowViewModel, including how tasks are grouped by emoji and how filter states are managed reactively. Include examples from the code showing how the emoji filter collections (_emojiFilters, _emojiExcludeFilters) are created and bound to the UI. Explain the inheritance mechanism where child tasks display the emoji of all their parent tasks. Address common issues such as emoji parsing edge cases, performance implications of real-time filtering on large datasets, and user experience considerations for emoji-based organization.

wiki_catalogs.name: Default Move Operation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the default drag-and-drop operation without modifier keys. Explain how this operation attaches the dragged task as a child of the target task by invoking the AddChild method through ITaskStorage. Document the implementation in MainWindowViewModel where the absence of keyboard modifiers results in a simple parenting operation. Include code examples showing the interaction between GraphControl's drag handlers and the ViewModel's task hierarchy management. Address user experience aspects such as visual feedback during the operation, handling of existing parent relationships when attaching, and the impact on task inheritance (such as emoji propagation). Provide guidance on when to use the default move operation versus modifier-based operations for task organization.

wiki_catalogs.name: Last Created View
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Last Created View in Unlimotion. Explain how the LastCreatedItems collection is populated by filtering recently created tasks based on creation date, applying date range filtering via LastCreatedDateFilter, and incorporating emoji-based filters. Document the reactive pipeline that monitors task creation events and maintains chronological ordering. Include code examples showing the SortBy operation that orders tasks by CreatedDateTime in descending order and the filtering logic that excludes completed tasks. Describe how this view helps users track their most recent work and maintain context. Address common user issues such as newly created tasks not appearing and provide troubleshooting steps related to date filter configuration and task state management.

wiki_catalogs.name: Core Features
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for this sub-feature or sub-component section. Thoroughly explain implementation details of core features including unlimited task nesting, multi-parent relationships, task blocking/unblocking logic, and roadmap visualization. Explain the domain model relationships in TaskItem (ContainsTasks, ParentTasks, BlocksTasks, BlockedByTasks) and their implementation in FileTaskStorage and TaskTreeManager. Include concrete examples from the actual codebase showing how tasks are added, moved, blocked, and deleted. Document the algorithms for determining task unlock status and completion eligibility. Address common issues and their solutions related to complex task relationships.

wiki_catalogs.name: Roadmap View
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Roadmap View in Unlimotion. Explain how the GraphViewModel integrates with the main application through the Graph property in MainWindowViewModel, visualizing task relationships and dependencies. Document how the view displays both hierarchical (parent-child) and blocking relationships between tasks using a graph-based representation. Include details on how the view consumes filtered task collections (FilteredItems) and applies emoji-based filtering for focused visualization. Describe the interactive features such as node selection, relationship highlighting, and navigation between related tasks. Address common visualization issues and provide guidance on optimizing the view for large task networks and performance considerations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Data Storage
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for this sub-feature or sub-component section. Thoroughly explain implementation details of data storage mechanisms including local file storage (JSON), server synchronization, and Git-based backup. Detail the FileTaskStorage implementation for reading/writing task files and ServerTaskStorage for remote operations. Explain the GitPullJob and GitPushJob scheduling components that enable automatic synchronization. Document the data persistence format, file structure, and recovery mechanisms including JsonRepairingReader. Include concrete examples of storage operations and configuration options. Address common issues like file corruption and synchronization conflicts.

wiki_catalogs.name: Settings View
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Settings View in Unlimotion. Explain how the SettingsViewModel is initialized in MainWindowViewModel and bound to the UI through the Settings property. Document the configuration system that persists user preferences such as view-specific sort orders, visibility of completed/archived tasks, and server mode settings. Include details on how settings are stored and retrieved using Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration and how changes are propagated reactively through WhenAnyValue subscriptions. Describe the integration with ClientSettings for application-level configuration. Address common configuration issues and provide troubleshooting guidance for settings persistence and synchronization across application restarts.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Reference
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the Unlimotion server endpoints. Document RESTful APIs implemented with ServiceStack including authentication endpoints, task operations, and user profile management. For each endpoint, document HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas, and authentication methods (JWT). Explain the AppHost configuration for CORS, JWT authentication, and exception handling. Include protocol-specific examples, error handling strategies, security considerations, and rate limiting information. Provide client implementation guidelines and performance optimization tips for interacting with the API.

wiki_catalogs.name: Integration Guide
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for this sub-feature or sub-component section. Thoroughly explain implementation details and usage patterns for integrations including the Telegram Bot and Git synchronization. For the Telegram Bot, document command handling (/search, /task, /root), callback queries, and message processing in the Bot class. Explain the polling mechanism and timer-based synchronization. For Git integration, detail the GitPullJob and GitPushJob implementations, configuration via GitSettings, and automatic commit/push intervals. Include concrete examples of integration workflows and configuration options. Address common issues and their solutions related to access control and synchronization timing.

wiki_catalogs.name: Development Guide
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on developing for the Unlimotion application. Explain the development environment setup, building the solution (Unlimotion.sln), and running tests. Document the testing strategy using Unlimotion.Test project with examples from MainWindowViewModelTests and TestHelpers. Explain contribution guidelines, code organization principles, and branching strategy. Include practical examples of adding new features, writing unit tests, and debugging common issues. Provide guidance on cross-platform development considerations for Desktop, Android, iOS, and Browser clients.

wiki_catalogs.name: Configuration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on configuring the Unlimotion application. Document client settings in ClientSettings.cs including TaskStorage Path and UI preferences. Explain server configuration in AppSettings.cs and appsettings.json including security settings, JWT authentication, and connection strings. Detail environment variable management through .env file and Docker configuration. Include practical examples of common configuration scenarios and their impact on application behavior. Address best practices for securing sensitive configuration data and managing different environments (development, production).

wiki_catalogs.name: Troubleshooting
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on troubleshooting the Unlimotion application. Document common issues and their solutions including startup failures, connection errors, synchronization problems, and UI rendering issues. Explain diagnostic techniques using log files, exception handling patterns, and debugging tools. Include guidance on interpreting error messages from the server and client applications. Provide recovery procedures for data corruption and synchronization conflicts. Address platform-specific issues on Windows, macOS, and Linux. Include practical examples of troubleshooting workflows and preventive measures.

wiki_overview.content:
<blog>
# Comprehensive Project Analysis: Unlimotion

## 1. Project Introduction

### Purpose Statement
Unlimotion is a sophisticated task management application designed to provide unlimited levels of task nesting, flexible task relationships, and comprehensive task organization. The application enables users to create complex task hierarchies with multiple parent relationships, implement task blocking mechanisms, and visualize task dependencies through various views including roadmap visualization.

### Core Goals and Objectives
The primary objectives of Unlimotion are to:
- Enable unlimited nesting levels for task organization
- Support complex task relationships where a single task can belong to multiple parent tasks simultaneously
- Provide visual roadmap views that illustrate task dependencies and execution chains
- Implement robust task blocking mechanisms to control task completion workflows
- Offer flexible data storage with local file-based persistence and potential server-based synchronization

### Target Audience
Unlimotion targets productivity-focused individuals and teams who require advanced task management capabilities beyond traditional hierarchical task managers. This includes project managers, software developers, researchers, and knowledge workers who need to manage complex interdependent tasks across multiple projects or domains.

## 2. Technical Architecture

### Component Breakdown
Unlimotion follows a modular monorepo architecture with distinct components serving specific purposes:

```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Unlimotion.Desktop] --> B[Unlimotion]
    C[Unlimotion.Android] --> B
    D[Unlimotion.iOS] --> B
    E[Unlimotion.Browser] --> B
    B --> F[Unlimotion.ViewModel]
    B --> G[Unlimotion.Domain]
    B --> H[Unlimotion.Interface]
    I[Unlimotion.Server] --> J[Unlimotion.Server.ServiceInterface]
    I --> K[Unlimotion.Server.ServiceModel]
    I --> G
    L[Unlimotion.TelegramBot] --> B
    M[Unlimotion.TaskTreeManager] --> G
    B --> M
```

### Design Patterns
The application implements several key design patterns:
- **Model-View-ViewModel (MVVM)**: Used extensively throughout the application with clear separation between UI components and business logic
- **Dependency Injection**: Utilizes Splat library for service registration and resolution
- **Observable Collections**: Implements reactive programming patterns using DynamicData library for collection management
- **Repository Pattern**: Abstracts data access through ITaskStorage interface with multiple implementations

### System Relationships
The system architecture demonstrates a client-server pattern with multiple client implementations sharing core business logic:

```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[Client Applications] --> B[Core Business Logic]
    B --> C[Data Access Layer]
    C --> D[Local Storage]
    C --> E[Server API]
    F[Server Application] --> G[Database]
    H[Telegram Bot] --> B
    I[Task Tree Manager] --> B
    B --> I
```

### Data Flow
The data flow within Unlimotion follows a consistent pattern across components:

```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[User Interface] --> B[ViewModel]
    B --> C[Task Storage]
    C --> D[Task Tree Manager]
    D --> E[Domain Models]
    E --> F[File System/Database]
    F --> G[Change Notification]
    G --> H[UI Update]
```

## 3. Key Implementation

### Main Entry Points
- **Desktop Application**: `src/Unlimotion.Desktop/Program.cs`
- **Server Application**: `src/Unlimotion.Server/Program.cs`
- **Android Application**: `src/Unlimotion.Android/MainActivity.cs`
- **iOS Application**: `src/Unlimotion.iOS/Main.cs`
- **Browser Application**: `src/Unlimotion.Browser/Program.cs`

### Core Modules
- **Task Management**: `src/Unlimotion.Domain/TaskItem.cs`
- **UI Components**: `src/Unlimotion/Views/`
- **ViewModel Layer**: `src/Unlimotion.ViewModel/MainWindowViewModel.cs`
- **Data Storage**: `src/Unlimotion/FileTaskStorage.cs`
- **Server Implementation**: `src/Unlimotion.Server/AppHost.cs`

### Configuration Approach
- **Application Settings**: `src/Unlimotion/ClientSettings.cs`
- **Server Configuration**: `src/Unlimotion.Server/AppSettings.cs`
- **Environment Variables**: `.env` file in root directory
- **Build Configuration**: `Directory.Build.props`

### External Dependencies
- **AvaloniaUI**: Cross-platform UI framework
- **Quartz.NET**: Job scheduling for Git synchronization
- **ServiceStack**: Server API framework
- **RavenDB**: Document database for server storage
- **AutoMapper**: Object-object mapping
- **DynamicData**: Reactive collections

### Integration Points
- **Git Integration**: `src/Unlimotion/Scheduling/Jobs/GitPullJob.cs`
- **Telegram Bot**: `src/Unlimotion.TelegramBot/Bot.cs`
- **SignalR**: `src/Unlimotion.Server/Startup.cs`
- **JWT Authentication**: `src/Unlimotion.Server/AppHost.cs`

### Component Relationships
```mermaid
graph LR
    A[Unlimotion] --> B[Unlimotion.ViewModel]
    A --> C[Unlimotion.Domain]
    A --> D[Unlimotion.TaskTreeManager]
    B --> C
    D --> C
    A --> E[Unlimotion.Interface]
    F[Unlimotion.Server] --> C
    F --> G[Unlimotion.Server.ServiceInterface]
    G --> C
    H[Unlimotion.TelegramBot] --> A
    I[Unlimotion.Desktop] --> A
    J[Unlimotion.Browser] --> A
```

## 4. Key Features

### Functionality Overview
Unlimotion provides a comprehensive task management system with advanced features including:
- Unlimited task nesting levels
- Multi-parent task relationships
- Task blocking/unblocking mechanisms
- Roadmap visualization
- Emoji-based task filtering
- Repeatable tasks
- Planned duration tracking
- Drag-and-drop task manipulation

### Implementation Highlights
- **Task States Management**: Implemented with clear state transitions as documented in README
- **Task Relationships**: Four types of task links (Parents, Containing, Blocking, Blocked)
- **Hierarchical Organization**: Tree-based structure with support for multiple parents
- **Blocking Logic**: Tasks are blocked if they have uncompleted subtasks or blocking tasks
- **View Modes**: Multiple tabs for different task perspectives (All Tasks, Last Created, Unlocked, etc.)

### Feature Architecture
```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
    [*] --> ApplicationStart
    ApplicationStart --> MainWindow: Initialize
    MainWindow --> AllTasks: Default View
    MainWindow --> LastCreated: Created Date Sort
    MainWindow --> Unlocked: Available Tasks
    MainWindow --> Completed: Finished Tasks
    MainWindow --> Archived: Stored Tasks
    MainWindow --> Roadmap: Graph View
    MainWindow --> Settings: Configuration
    AllTasks --> TaskManipulation: Create/Edit/Delete
    TaskManipulation --> DataPersistence: Save to Storage
    DataPersistence --> FileStorage: JSON Files
    DataPersistence --> ServerStorage: API Calls
    TaskManipulation --> UIUpdate: Reactive Refresh
```

Sources:
- [README.md](README.md)
- [App.axaml.cs](src/Unlimotion/App.axaml.cs)
- [ApplicationViewModel.cs](src/Unlimotion/ApplicationViewModel.cs)
- [TaskItem.cs](src/Unlimotion.Domain/TaskItem.cs)
- [AppHost.cs](src/Unlimotion.Server/AppHost.cs)
- [Startup.cs](src/Unlimotion.Server/Startup.cs)
- [MainWindowViewModel.cs](src/Unlimotion.ViewModel/MainWindowViewModel.cs)
- [FileTaskStorage.cs](src/Unlimotion/FileTaskStorage.cs)
</blog>
